PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.label: terrestrial
PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.description: Terrestrial creatures are adapted to move on land. They can cross shallow water, but deeper bodies of water present a challenge to them.

PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.label: aquatic
PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.description: Aquatic creatures can swim through deep water with ease, but are helpless on land.

PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.label: amphibious
PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.description: Amphibious creatures can move easily on both water and land.

PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.label: driller
PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.description: Drilling creatures dig through soil and sand, but cannot move over rock or water.

PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.label: flying
PathfindingFramework.MovementDef.description: Flying creatures can hover over most obstacles.
